meanings.def: the scientific study of the earth’s surface, physical features, divisions, products, population, etc.
the way in which the physical features of a place are arranged
examples: These streets had a very particular geography.
the geography of New York City
Kim knew the geography of the building and strode along the corridor.
The geography of the area makes travel very difficult.
The island's geography is very simple.
I wasn't familiar with the geography of the town.

meanings.def: the way in which a particular aspect of life or society is influenced by geography or varies according to geography
examples: The geography of poverty and the geography of voting are connected.
We are now operational across multiple geographies.
